content: ईश् {c2c} <ab>A.</ab> (ईष्टे, ईशांचक्रे, ऐशिष्ट, ईशिता, ईशितुं, ईशित) {@--1@} To rule, be master of, govern, command (with <ab>gen.</ab>) नायं गात्राणामीष्टे <ls>K. 312</ls> <ab>v. l.</ab>; अर्थानामीशिषे त्वं वयमपि च गिरामीश्महे यावदर्थं <ls>Bh. 3. 30</ls>; sometimes with <ab>acc.</ab>; इमाँल्लोकानीशत ईशनीभिः <ls>Śvet. Up.</ls> (also used in the Veda with <ab>gen.</ab> of an infinitive or <ab>loc.</ab> of an abstract noun). {@--2@} To be able, have power; expressed by ‘can’; माधुर्यमीष्टे हरिणान् ग्रहीतुं <ls>R. 18. 13</ls>, <ls n="R.">14. 38</ls>; कमिवेशते रमयितुं न गुणाः <ls>Ki. 6. 24</ls>; <ls>U. 7. 4</ls>; <ls>Śi. 1. 38</ls>; <ls>Māl. 10. 13.</ls> {@--3@} To act like a master, allow. {@--4@} To own, possess. {@--5@} To belong to.
ईश् {%<ab>m.</ab>%} A master, lord, the Supreme spirit.
